title: changmingsuo
body:
A chángmìngsuǒ (长命锁) or “longevity lock” is a lock-shaped ornament in China made of metal and hung around a child’s neck to pray for longevity.

Hmong girls often wear large silver locks(chang ming suo) on their chests, which are the main accessories in Miao silver jewelry.

The "chang ming suo" was very popular in Han Chinese regions during the chinese Ming and Qing dynasties. It was believed that by putting this ornament on a child after birth, it could protect them from disasters and evil spirits, ensuring their peace and longevity

H4. Examples
* !asset #23155973: Various changmingsuo.

title: cocolia_(honkai_impact)
body:
Non-playable character from [[Honkai (series)|]] series.

A member of Anti-Entropy and the owner of an orphanage, she is also known as "Matushka."

[spoiler]Cocolia used to serve the Red Army in Siberia along with Colonel Alexei Zaitsev, [[Bronya Zaychik|Bronya]]'s late father. However, the Honkai broke in Siberia during the 2nd Eruption, killing Alexei in the process, whose dying wish pleads her to use his car key to save his wife and unborn child. Initially not wanting to comply, Cocolia later stumbled upon [[Alexandra Pavlovna Zaychik]], holding her hostage to keep her calm before the two escaped.

Over a decade later, Cocolia captures Bronya who was attempting to assassinate her as a high-profile target, eventually Cocolia adopted Bronya as her daughter along with other known children such as [[Seele Vollerei]], [[Sin Mal]], [[Liliya Olenyeva]], and [[Rozaliya Olenyeva]].[/spoiler]

The [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] iteration of Cocolia, unlike her [[Honkai Impact 3rd|Honkai Impact]] or [[Cocolia Rand|Star Rail]] counterparts, had a biological daughter named Natasha (not to be confused with [[Raven_(honkai_impact)|]] or her [[Natasha (Honkai: Star Rail)|Star Rail]] counterpart) that died. [[Otto Apocalypse]] later makes a clone of this daughter named [[Ninti Apocalypse]].

h4.See Also
* [[Cocolia Rand]] - her [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.

title: the_nether_(minecraft)
body:
A [[hell]]ish dimension in [[Minecraft]] inhabited by potentially hostile mobs.

It is accessible from the Overworld through a [[nether portal]] frame constructed of [[obsidian (gemstone)|]] blocks. Contains draconian terrain generation dominated by [[netherrack (minecraft)|]], absence of day/night cycle, fungi-based vegetation, and great oceans of [[lava]]. Do not try sleeping there.

title: piglin
body:
Humanoid [[pig]]-like neutral mob in [[Minecraft]] that spawns in [[The Nether (minecraft)|]]. Piglins can wear any [[armor]], and armed with either golden [[sword]] or [[crossbow]]. Has very small chance to drop one of those weapons upon death. Piglins are always hostile to [[Wither Skeleton (minecraft)|]]s. Baby piglins are passive and will run away when hit.

If the player is caught mining a (gold) ore, opening or breaking any container, or simply not wearing gold armor on sight, piglins will attack.

h4. See also

* [[Piglin Brute]]

A [[Piglin]] or [[Piglin Brute]] that stays in the Overworld or [[the End (Minecraft)|]] will zombify.

title: jesmon
body:
A Holy Knight [[Digimon]]. JESmon is a caped knight whose armor is full of spikes. It has three spirit-like apparitions that follow it around, named Atho, René and Por, and with them it can unleash its most dangerous attack, "Un Pour Tous" (One for All).

JESmon is the final evolution of [[Hackmon (digimon)|]] after being thorougly trained by [[Gankoomon]]. Its dedication and strong sense of justice earned it the most recent spot in the prestigious Royal Knights, as well as its title of "Warrior of Salvation" (救世の戦士, [i]Guze no Senshi[/i]).

JESmon may evolve to [[JESmon X-Antibody]] using the X-Antibody; from there, it may further evolve to [[JESmon GX]] using its mentor Gankoomon's power.

title: eros_(phantom_of_the_kill)
body:
A character from [[Phantom of the Kill]]

Birthday: May 8th
Height: 156cm
Weight: 50kgs
B/W/H: 94/57/87
Blood Type: O
CV: Shizuka Ito
Illustrator: だーくろ

A passionate and loving Killer Princess, she is not that well suited for combat, but is loved by everyone for her charming personality and appearance. Her Killium comes from the divine bow of the god of love, Eros, and this has given her a keen interest in people's love lives--she spends her time either trying to mediate between people, or trying to tear them apart. However, this interest only applies to the love lives of others, and she herself is shy and dim-witted when it comes to romance.

title: melting_love
body:
An Abnormality made of pink [[slime (substance)|slime]] from the [[Project Moon]] universe, originating from [[Lobotomy Corporation]].

Its initial form is a [[slime girl]] with [[very long hair]]. Its eyes ranging from [[yellow eyes|yellow]] to [[white eyes|white]] with [[colored sclera]]. Part of its body forms a puddle on the ground.

When [spoilers]breaching containment[/spoilers], it loses its humanoid form, becoming a round mass supported by a column of slime emerging from its puddle. [[bone|Bones]] and [[skull|skulls]] are visible within this form.

Its associated [[e.g.o (project moon)|E.G.O]] is [[adoration (e.g.o)|Adoration]].

title: jirou_(ramen)
body:
A popular variation of the [[ramen]] bowl made with tonkotsu (pork bone) and shoyu (soy) broth. There is a lot of fat in the cuts of pork included, and the noodles are not as thick as regular ramen noodles, but are known to be piled on high, making it difficult to finish. It is also often expressed by a high mountain of [[bean sprout]]s on the pork and noodles.

title: warthog_(halo)
body:
One of the most recognizable vehicles from [[halo_(series)|Halo]]. The Warthog is a large, four-wheel off-road vehicle with a profile similar to a dune buggy and typically carries a driver, single passenger, and an operator for its tri-barrelled machine gun mounted on the back. Variants will carry additional troops or different weapons such as rockets and gauss cannons.

A civilian variant of the Warthog is sold within the Halo universe, known simply as the [[Hog (halo)|]].

title: battle_of_okinawa
body:
[b]The Battle of Okinawa[/b] (Japanese: 沖縄戦, Hepburn: [i]Okinawa-sen[/i]), codenamed [b]Operation Iceberg[/b],  was a battle of the Pacific War fought on the island of [[Okinawa]] by the [[United States Army]] and [[United States Marine Corps]] forces against the [[Imperial Japanese Army]].

The initial invasion of Okinawa on 1 April 1945 was the largest amphibious assault in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]]. The 82-day battle lasted from 1 April until 22 June 1945. After a long campaign of island hopping, the Allies were planning to use Kadena Air Base on the large island of Okinawa as a base for Operation Downfall, the planned invasion of the Japanese home islands, 340 mi (550 km) away.

The battle has been referred to as the "typhoon of steel" in English, of which the Japanese original phrase was "tetsu no bōfū". The nicknames refer to the ferocity of the fighting, the intensity of Japanese kamikaze attacks and the sheer numbers of Allied ships and armored vehicles that assaulted the island. The battle was the bloodiest in the Pacific, with around 50,000 Allied and 84,166–117,000 Japanese casualties,  including Okinawans conscripted into the Japanese Army. According to local authorities, at least 149,425 Okinawan people were killed, died by coerced suicide or went missing.

In [[operation_ten-gou|the naval operations surrounding the battle]], both sides lost considerable numbers of [[ship]]s and [[aircraft]], including the [[yamato_(battleship)|Japanese battleship Yamato]]. 

After the American [[victory]] in the battle, which was very costly (50,000 U.S. soldier casualties, includeed 12,500 killed and missing as well as 36,122 wounded), Okinawa provided a fleet anchorage, troop staging areas, and airfields in proximity to Japan for US forces in preparation for "the invasion of the Japanese home islands":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Downfall.

The high number of U.S. casualties in this battle was one of the reasons for their [[Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki]] to end [[the Pacific]] war.

title: 1993_russian_constitutional_crisis
body:
The 1993 Russian constitutional crisis was a major political conflict between President Boris Yeltsin and the Russian parliament.
It began on September 21, 1993, when Yeltsin issued a decree dissolving the parliament, accusing it of obstructing his reforms.
In response, the parliament declared Yeltsin’s decree invalid, impeached him, and appointed Vice President Alexander Rutskoy as acting president. 

The standoff escalated into armed clashes in Moscow, culminating on October 4, when Yeltsin ordered military forces to storm the White House (the parliament building).
Tanks fired on the building, and troops moved in to suppress the resistance, resulting in significant casualties and the arrest of opposition leaders. 

The crisis ended with Yeltsin’s victory and the adoption of a new constitution that significantly expanded presidential powers, marking a turning point towards a more centralized and authoritarian government.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: 1993 Russian constitutional crisis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1993_Russian_constitutional_crisis]

title: akanbe
body:
A Japanese facial gesture that consists of [[eyelid pull|pulling an eyelid]] down while sticking the [[tongue out]]. It is sometimes accompanied by the sound べえだ (beeda, pronounced "behhh-dah"). This gesture is also done in France and Québec, where it is accompanied by saying "mon oeil" ("my eye").

The gist of the gesture is an infantile taunt - the Japanese equivalent of thumbing your nose at someone, or yelling "Nyah nyah nyah" or "Neener neener" or the like.

title: w_(girls'_frontline)
body:
Scrapped design for what is commonly speculated to have potentially been the sixth member of the [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]].

Conceptually, not much is known about her, as she made limited appearances prior to a similar design being implemented in [[Arknights]], in the form of [[W (arknights)|]]. Aside from post #3731497 (shared February 2016 during [[Girls' Frontline]]'s third beta), [[lowlight kirilenko|Hai Mao]] had drawn her with [[M4 SOPMOD II (girls' frontline)|]] on "a signboard":[https://zh.moegirl.org/File:%E6%B5%B7%E7%8C%AB%E7%BB%9C%E5%90%88%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84W%E7%AD%BE%E7%BB%98.jpg] for a fan of the latter, around 2016 whilst they were selling a new doujin book (to the curiosity of the fan who'd later share the art on Weibo). With the design resemblance, and already designating her with the name W, players have thus decided to refer to this version of her as such too.

Design-wise, just as with Arknights' W, she appears to have white/silver hair along with dark red accents, though more akin to SOPMOD and less like antennae. Though both having bandanas or scarfs, in place of red horns, she wears a headset. Uniquely to her, she appears to have a mole under her left eye, and appears to have a walkie-talkie on her left shoulder. On the signboard, she also has hands like those SOPMOD has. 

Though the association with SOPMOD has brought some speculation as to what her weapon may have been, it is most commonly thought to be the one that Arknights' W is seen with, a Mk18 Mod0 (derived from the SOPMOD accessory system for the [[M4 Carbine]]); otherwise known as the CQBR or CQBW (CQB Weapon), with some proponents of this theory speculating the "W" in her name to derive from the latter, bolstered by the fact that Arknights' W has "CQBW" as her in-game codename. In 2024, Girls' Frontline finally added [[mk.18 (girls' frontline)|a character]] representing the Mk18 Mod0.

Following Hai Mao's departure from MICA Team in 2017, and the formation of HyperGryph, it is probable that Hai Mao recycled the design for Arknights, alongside other elements they contributed that didn't make the cut for Girls' Frontline (such as the proto-Doctor design found with proto-W, or their proposed draft for the early chapters prior to Jano [热运动] rewriting it, involving an amnesiac Commander awaking in the middle of combat against an abstractly and fantastically strong Sangvis Ferri).

title: tennouboshi_uzume
body:
One of main character from [[Shin Jigen Game Neptune VII|Megadimension Neptunia VII]]. A dreamer girl who fights alone in a spirited way in order to save the Zero Dimension. She appears to be a [[tomboy]] in her human form, but in her HDD form, [[Orange Heart (neptunia)|]], she is much girlier. She represents the [[Sega Dreamcast]].

[Spoiler] Originally she was Planeptune's CPU, but because of her power to make dreams come true, Gamindustri began to hate her and had to be sealed away, she ended up creating the Uranus CPU so that she would be forgotten in history. Due to the hatred, her Share Energy became Negative Energy, creating her other part called [[Ankokuboshi Kurome]]. [/Spoiler]

Uzume's first name refers to the Japanese goddess of dawn, mirth and revelry, Ame-no-Uzume-no-Mikoto (天鈿女命). Her tough attitude may be a reference to the Kogo Shui (古語拾遺)'s interpretation of "Uzume" (鈿女) as "Woman of Strength". Uzume's last name, Tennouboshi (天王星, lit. Heaven King Star), the Japanese name for the planet Uranus, is a reference to Sega Uranus; a possibly unused Sega console codename.

Orange Heart's name is inspired by the orange swirl on the Sega Dreamcast.

"Uzu" is Japanese for "whirlpool" or "swirl", referencing the Dreamcast symbol.

Voiced by: [[Honda Mariko]] (Japanese), Erica Lindbeck (English)

h4. See also

*[spoiler] [[Ankokuboshi Kurome]], Other Version.[/spoiler]

*[[Orange Heart (neptunia)|]], in her HDD form.

title: ao_racing
body:
An American [[racecar|motorsports]] team founded in 2022. The team participates in the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]], and has made appearances in the [[World Endurance Championship]] with GT3 [[Porsche 911]]s and an [[Oreca 07]] LMP2.

AO Racing is primarily known for [[Rexy (AO Racing)|]], a green dinosaur-liveried 911 that was an instant hit with fans and inspired the team's green dinosaur mascot. Rexy's popularity led the team to eventually introduce a sister car named Roxy, featuring a pink dinosaur livery and matching mascot. They later expanded into the [[le mans prototype|LMP2]] class with a dragon-themed car named Spike.

title: osaka_(city)
body:
One of [[Japan]]'s major cities. A city in the Kansai region of Japan's main island of Honshu, a designated city under the Local Autonomy Law, the capital city of Osaka Prefecture and also the biggest part of Keihanshin (京阪神) area, which is represented by three major cities of Japan, [[Kyoto]] ([u]京[/u]都), Osaka (大[u]阪[/u]) and [[Kobe]] ([u]神[/u]戸). Located at the mouth of the Yodo River on Osaka Bay, Osaka is the third largest city by population after [[tokyo_(city)|Tokyo]] (special wards) and [[Yokohama]].

h4. Locations

h4. Landmarks

title: chappelle's_show
body:
A sketch comedy show created by Dave Chappelle and Neal Brennan, that aired on Comedy Central from 2003 to 2006. Starting Dave Chappelle himself along with his castmates, the series satirized and examined—through dark and racial humor—race, social stereotypes, masculinity, celebrity culture, and comedy itself.

The series was a hit with many of it's sketch's being memorable including the [I]Charlie Murphy's True Hollywood Stories[/i]. The series abruptly ended in season 3 with only three episodes, following Chappelle quitting the series after being burned out and angry that many of his fans failed to understand the racist jokes he made on the show were making fun of racism, not perpetuating it.

title: fanged_bangs
body:
Bangs that have noticeably longer tapering extremities than the main bunch, going at least to eye-level, giving the appearance of hair "fangs". The "fangs" have to be on the sides of the bangs and are basically extensions of the outer edges of the bangs.

The difference between fanged bangs and [[sidelocks]] is that fanged bangs are usually thinner and are clearly part of the bangs, not the sides of the hair, while sidelocks are usually thicker and come from the top and the sides of the hair.

The tag also applies when only one side of the bangs is fanged.

title: thumbnail_surprise
body:
A post which intentionally uses technical tricks to present a full sized image that is deceptively different from its thumbnail.

This tag covers the following types of surprises:

* Animations that build up to a startling climax.
* Animation frame tricks that flip away from the first frame as soon as the full image finishes loading or after a long delay. Danbooru doesn't always use the first frame as the thumbnail, so these tricks may not work.
* Images with optical illusions that exploit digital image resizes and handling of [[transparent background]]s.
* Images with cleverly placed halftone effects that are designed to be completely obfuscated when the image is scaled to thumbnail sizes.

Some tricks exploit a peculiarity of a specific platform, and will only work in certain browsers or on certain websites. In particular, thumbnail surprises from Twitter frequently depend in some way on Twitter's image handling and won't show up correctly on Danbooru.

This tag is for intentional, technical exploits only. For non-technical exploits or artistic accidents, please use the Misleading Thumbnails pool.

h4. See also

* pool #1229 - Misleading Thumbnails
* [[exif thumbnail surprise]]

title: dragon_god_(touhou)
body:
[[Touhou]] character.

The Dragon God is, according to [[Hieda no Akyuu]]'s account in [[Perfect Memento in Strict Sense]], the highest god of [[Gensokyo]]. According to that same account, the dragon looks like a serpent with hands and horns and that is thicker than a great tree that's thousands of years old, and is so long that it can block out the sky. Co-creator of Gensokyo alongside [[Yakumo Yukari]] and the other Youkai Sages, but it has not been seen since it assisted Yukari with constructing the Great Hakurei Barrier.

[[Hakurei Shrine]] is generally attributed to the Dragon God by fans, since it is the nexus point of the Great Hakurei Barrier they helped create, but there is no concrete evidence in canon.

Might be based on the mythological Ryūjin, dragon-god of the ocean and storms, though more canonical information points towards Tenryuu, the celestial dragon of the [[Big Dipper]], which would also give it a connection to [[Matara Okina]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Dragon (God)":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Dragon_(God)
* "Wikipedia: Ryujin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryūjin

title: internet_explorer
body:
[b]Internet Explorer[/b] (formerly [b]Microsoft Internet Explorer[/b] and [b]Windows Internet Explorer[/b], commonly abbreviated [b]IE[/b] or [b]MSIE[/b]) is a series of graphical web browsers developed by [[Microsoft]] and included as part of the [[Microsoft Windows]] line of operating systems, starting in 1995. It was first released as part of the add-on package [i]Plus! for Windows 95[/i] that year. Later versions were available as free downloads, or in service packs, and included in the OEM service releases of Windows 95 and later versions of Windows.

Infamous for its slow speed and its vulnerability to various malware and computer virus, it was later replaced with [[Microsoft Edge]] starting from [[Windows 10]].

h4. See also

* [[Aizawa Inori]], unofficial (at the moment of writing) [[personification]] of [b]IE[/b].
* [[Internet Explorer (webcomic)|]], a webcomic written by [[Merryweather]] and illustrated by [[Hinghoi]], featuring personifications of internet browsers.
** [[Internet Explorer (merryweather)|]], the comic's title character, also a personification of [b]IE[/b].
* [[Open in Internet Explorer]]
* [[OS-tan]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://microsoft.com/ie
* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer

title: beetlejuice_beetlejuice
body: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice is a 2024 American dark fantasy comedy horror film directed by Tim Burton from a screenplay by Alfred Gough and Miles Millar. A sequel to [[Beetlejuice]] (1988) and the second film of the Beetlejuice franchise, the film stars [[Michael Keaton]], Winona Ryder, and Catherine O'Hara reprising their roles alongside new cast members Justin Theroux, Monica Bellucci, Jenna Ortega, and [[Willem Dafoe]]. In the film, set decades after the first Beetlejuice, [[Lydia Deetz]], now a mother, struggles to keep her family together in the wake of a loss, as the specter Betelgeuse returns to haunt her.

title: need_for_speed:_carbon
body:
A 2006 entry in the [[Need for Speed]] franchise, and direct sequel to [[Need for Speed: most wanted (2005)|Most Wanted]]. Despite being a sequel to MW, Carbon featured different progression, mostly focused around winning races to capture parts of the city. The most notable feature of the game are the Canyon Battles, 1v1 boss races on narrow, winding roads inspired by Japanese touge racing.

While the game's cover depicts a Canyon Battle between a [[Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution]] and a [[Dodge Challenger (3rd generation)|3rd gen]] [[Dodge Challenger]], the most well known car from this installment is the [[Audi R8]] (listed under its concept name of [b]Audi Le Mans Quattro[/b]) driven by the main antagonist Darius.

title: need_for_speed:_underground_2
body:
A 2004 installment in the [[Need for Speed]] franchise, and direct sequel to [[Need for Speed: Underground]]. Underground 2 is particularly notable for being the first NFS game to feature a fully open world and free roam, features that would become mainstays in the franchise.

The game's cover car is a custom green [[Nissan 350Z]] belonging to Rachel Teller, the player's friend. It also returns in many later installments.
other_names: ニード・フォー・スピード

title: need_for_speed:_underground
body:

The game's cover car is an orange [[Nissan skyline r34|R34]] [[Nissan Skyline GT-R]] belonging to Eddie, the game's main antagonist. It appears again in later installments.

title: antinomy_of_common_flowers
body:
[i]Touhou Hyouibana[/i] (lit. "Eastern Flower Possession")

An official [i][[touhou|Touhou Project]][/i] fighting game by Tasofro, the 15.5th in the series, which introduced [[Yorigami Jo'on]] and [[Yorigami Shion]] as characters. It was released on December 29th, 2017, at Comiket 93. It was also released for [[steam_(platform)|Steam]] on Janurary 5, 2018, as well as for [[Playstation 4]] and [[Nintendo Switch]] on April 22, 2021, making it the first official [i]Touhou[/i] game to be released on gaming consoles.

As with [i][[Urban Legend in Limbo]][/i], it features character art by [[Harukawa Moe]].

A trailer was released on October 5th, 2017, revealing that [[Doremy Sweet]] would be a playable character alongside the already previewed [i][[Urban Legend in Limbo]][/i] cast.

On December 18th, 2017, Tasofro revealed that [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] would also be a playable character. This was followed on December 21st, 2017, with the announcement that [[Yakumo Yukari]] was also on the roster.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Antinomy of Common Flowers":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Antinomy_of_Common_Flowers

title: hair_bobbles
body:
A [[hair ornament]] consisting of an elastic band with one or more bobbles, frequently two large balls, used to tie the hair. It works by wrapping the band around a bundle of hair and securing it by stretching the band over and around the bobble.

Stereotypically associated with young or teenage girls.

Not to be confused with [[hair beads]]. Hair beads usually consist of many smaller beads and aren't always used to tie the hair. Hair bobbles usually consist of two larger beads normally used to tie the hair.

* !post #516909

title: father_ted
body:
Father Ted was a British sitcom written by Irish writers that aired from 1995 to 1998.

The sitcom follows [[Father Ted Crilly]], an Irish Catholic Priest who is sent to the fictional Craggy Island as punishment for embezzling money from the church. While at Craggy Island, Father Ted has to deal with a cast of crazy and weird locals and other Catholic Priests who live there.

The International Olympics Committee chose not to renew its licensing deal with [[Nintendo]] and [[Sega]] for the 2024 Olympic Games, making [[Mario & Sonic at the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games]] the final Mario & Sonic game.

title: detroit_miku
body:
A fan made variation of [[Hatsune Miku]] that comes from a Tweet where a user [[ai-generated art (topic)|made an AI prompt]] of "Miku yelling at a police officer in a Detroit suburb". The result was a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] [[alternate skin color|version]] of Miku wearing multiple [[chain necklace]]s and [[bracelet]]s, a [[baseball cap]], and a [[cropped shirt]] with anime characters printed on it.

h4. Examples

title: kartrider
body:
Crazyracing KartRider is an online multiplayer kart racing game developed by Nexon Co. It's part of the Crazy Arcade Franchise.

Playable on PC Only, KartRider features fictitious fantasy vehicles and branded game models bases on real-life cars.

Released in June 1, 2004 on Korea until it's shut down in 2023, but it still operating in China under the name of popKart.

Other games from this franchise were KartRider: Rush+ for Mobile Only and [[KartRider: Drift]] .

The first title in the [[Mario & Sonic (series)|]] series. Released in 2007 for the [[Wii]], and 2008 for the [[Nintendo DS]].

This game introduces summer sports outfits for Peach, Amy, and Blaze, and reuses Daisy's outfit from [[Mario Power Tennis]]. No other characters have alternate costumes except for Sonic, who wears a yellow [[life vest]] during Aquatics events.

title: home_security
body:
「自宅警備隊」 "home security force", 「自宅警備員」 "home security guard", and variants.

Euphemism for [[NEET]] and/or [[hikikomori]].

One variety takes the gag to the extreme in a parody of [[s.w.a.t.|SWAT teams]], complete with [[tactical clothes]] such as [[load bearing vest]]s, [[helmet]]s, etc.; see "ja.wikipedia":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%87%AA%E5%AE%85%E8%AD%A6%E5%82%99%E9%9A%8A_N.E.E.T.

title: spell_card
body:
A magically infused card used to cast spells. 

Most commonly (but not exclusively) seen in [[Touhou]]-related images. They first appeared there in the sixth game, and have been a mainstay of the series ever since. Spell cards allow the casting of powerful, intricate [[danmaku]] patterns or the usage of special abilities.

This tag is only used to denote the presence of an [b]actual, physical spell card[/b]. Images that portray a recognizable spell card's spell in action or its effects should be tagged with [[spell]]. A few of these are shown frequently enough that they have dedicated tags on Danbooru, however ([[Four of a Kind (touhou)|]], for example), so consider using those tags as well when appropriate.

title: master_spark
body:
[b]Love Sign: Master Spark[/b]

[[Kirisame Marisa]]'s most commonly used and powerful spellcard attack. It appears in almost all of the [[Touhou]] series games (PoFV, MoF and the PC-98 games excluded.)

Despite being originally created and used by [[Kazami Yuuka]],  Marisa (after "borrowing" it) has made it a trademark spellcard of hers, to the point where one of her theme songs is titled "Love-Colored Master Spark".

[i]This is how Marisa uses it:[/i]
* Concentrate your mind 
* Mutter the spell to the Mini-Hakkero tenderly 
* Aim at someone you don't like 
* Now unleash your annihilation of love!

There's also Marisa's "Last Word" spellcard, known as "Magicannon: Final Spark", "Dual Spark", used by Yuka, which is two Master Sparks fired at once (one being fired by a projected doppelganger), and [[Mima (touhou)|]]'s fan-made Twilight Spark, which is usually a dark violet in color and extremely wide. An even stronger version exists in fanworks as "Magicannon: Final Master Spark", but is rarely seen.

h4. See also
[[Dark Spark (touhou)|]]
other_names: 恋符「マスタースパーク」

title: dark_spark_(touhou)
body:
A dark, evil reimagination of [[Kirisame Marisa]]'s emblematic attack, the [[Master Spark]], created in the days between ZUN's announcement of [[Touhou]] 14: [[Double Dealing Character]] on 11 May, 2013, and the launch of the demo at Reitaisai 10 on 26 May. 

Its origin lies in ZUN's announcement post, in which he hints at a youkai rebellion and the playable characters' magical artifacts behaving in an abnormal manner.

title: lily_of_the_valley
body:
[i][b]Convallaria[/b][/i] is a poisonous woodland flowering plant in the family [i]Asparagaceae[/i], native to cool temperate climates in North America, Europe, and Asia. Its Japanese name is 鈴蘭 / スズラン ([i]suzuran[/i]) and its Chinese name is 鈴蘭 / 铃兰 ([i]Linglan[/i]).

The [[flower]]s come in clusters, dangling from curved, alternating offshoots from a main stem (aka raceme) and are bell-shaped and (usually) [[white flower|white]]. All parts of the plant are poisonous, including its red berries.

Not to be confused with [[snowbell (flower)|]]s, as they bear a strong resemblance to lily of the valley. Visual points to note: [i]Snowbells[/i] have a green or yellow spot on the tip of each petal; each flower-bearing stem (called a pedicel) ends in a "bulb" (receptacle) to which a flower is attached. A good visual example is post #2894988 with snowbells on the left and lilies of the valley on the right. Also, not to be confused with [[bellflower]] whose flowers typically have a longer, less rounded bell shape.

Often associated with the characters [[Medicine Melancholy]] and [[Suzuran (arknights)|]].

h4. Examples
* !asset #23134640: Photo reference
* !post #11520
* !post #7865272

h4. Non-examples
* !post #679635: [[Snowbell (flower)|]]
* !post #2382502: [[Bellflower]]
* !post #5964631: [[Pieris japonica]]

h4. Other Asparagaceae species
* [[Agave]]
* [[Asparagus]]
* [[Bluebell (flower)|]]
* [[Grape hyacinth]]
* [[Grass lily]] (Ornithogalum)
* [[Hyacinth]]
* [[Tuberose]]

h4. See also
* [[Pieris japonica]], also called Lily of the valley shrub
* [[Sandersonia (flower)|]], also called Golden lily of the valley
* [[Snowbell (flower)|]]
* [[Tag group:Flowers]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Convallaria":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convallaria
* "Wikipedia: Lily of the valley (Convallaria majalis)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lily_of_the_valley
* "Wikipedia: Asparagaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asparagaceae

title: troll
body:
A race of fearsome creatures from [[Norse mythology]].

Originally more or less the Nordic equivalents of [[giant]]s, although often smaller in size, endowed with oversized ears and noses, and long bushy tails. Their modern appearance, codified in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], is that of a bulky humanoid creature equal or larger than an [[orc]] with thick [[grey skin|grey]] or [[dark skin|brown skin]], but with much less intelligence and very poor eyesight.

Not to be confused with the act of [[trolling]].

h4. See also

* [[dwarf]]
* [[elf]]
* [[ogre]]
* [[oni]]
* [[orc]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a blue [[halterneck]] [[bikini]] top with white [[frills]], which is parted to expose her [[navel]], [[yellow flower]]s in her hair, a cyan [[parasol]], white [[fingerless gloves]], and blue [[sandals]] with white frills.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Fiora in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: utada_hikaru
body:
[b]Utada Hikaru[/b] (January 19, 1983) is Japanese-American singer, songwriter and producer. Considered one of the most influential, bestselling musical artists in Japan, she has produced several hit songs including "Automatic", "First Love", "Can You Keep a Secret?" and "Simple and Clean", the theme song of the [[Kingdom Hearts]] games.

Having grew up in [[New York City]], Utada is fluent in English and Japanese. Has a son with her ex-husband, Francesco Calliano. On June 26, 2021, Utada came out as non-binary but uses both she/her and they/them pronouns.

title: low_tide_in_twilight
body:
Low Tide in Twilight is an ongoing manhwa written and illustrated by euja. Released in 2021, it has been published by Lezhin.

Kim Euihyun has decided he doesn’t want to live. He feels nothing anymore. He has no future to look forward to. Now, he’s looking into the abyss, holding in his arms the only thing that was keeping him alive. It’ll all be over soon. But someone grabs him from the water’s edge, and pulls him from the darkness. Euihyun, whose sole possession is a mountain of debt, has been rescued by Taeju. Now Taeju has offered Euihyun money, a house, and a job to help him out of his mess. But what will Taeju, who is intoxicated by Euihyun’s smell, ask for in return? Could Taeju be the person that finally brings Euihyun out of his eternal twilight…?

title: amd
body:
[b]Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.[/b] ([b]AMD[/b]) is an American multinational semiconductor company based in Sunnyvale, California, United States, that develops [[computer]] processors and related technologies for business and consumer markets. AMD is the only significant rival to [[Intel]] in the central processor (CPU) market for (x86-based) personal computers. Since acquiring "ATI":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ATI_Technologies in 2006, AMD and its competitor [[Nvidia]] have dominated the discrete graphics processor unit (GPU) market.

Colloquially referred to as "Team Red".

title: school_bus
body:
A [[bus]], typically yellow, designed to transport students to and from [[school]] or any school-related activities.  

In 1939 by conference a shade of yellow, now known as school bus yellow, was decided to be used as the standard color for school buses in North America. While there is no standard requiring yellow to be used on school buses outside of North America, the uniqueness of the color and its association with schools has lead to some school systems outside North America to also adopt school buses of this color.

title: ashigara_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Ashigara[/i]. Introduced as part of the [i]Ink-Stained Steel Sakura[/i] rerun. Character design by [[Tetsujin Momoko]], voiced by [[Saitou Chiwa]].

Her base art portrays her with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[wolf ears]], and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a blue [[serafuku]] (with [[white sailor collar]]), [[blue skirt]], black [[thighhighs]], a single [[black gloves|black glove]] on her left hand, two white [[bracelet|bracelets]] on her right arm, and [[rudder footwear]]. She also wears [[headphones]] connected to a music player that looks like a [[Walkman]], and wields a [[katana]].

Her rig shows four 20.3 cm twin mounts, two per side, as well as two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] with the [[Sakura Empire (emblem)|Sakura Empire]] emblem marked on the splinter shield tops.

h4. Skins

body:
A rattail is a hair style that is characterized by a long "tail"-like element of hair growing downward from the back of the head. The rattail usually hangs naturally; however, it can be braided, treated as a dread, permed, straightened, poofed, or curled with an iron. In some instances, an individual might choose to grow several tails as opposed to a single very long tail. A rattail is characterised by hair longer than the rest of the hair surrounding it.

title: sushang_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

She is an amateur member of the Xianzhou Luofu's Cloud Knights who aspires to become a renowned figure of the said group. Voiced by [[Fukuen Misato]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit is a stylized Cloud Knight uniform comprising a [[white dress]] worn under an outer layer [[black dress]] with [[yellow sleeves|yellow]] [[detached sleeves]], [[jingle bell]]s on [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Costumes
* !post #7690451: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
A naive and enthusiastic newcomer to the Cloud Knights who wields a Greatsword.

She envisions the historic legends of the Cloud Knights, and is eager to become such a figure herself.

As such, Sushang firmly believes in the philosophies "be eager to help those in need", "do one good deed a day and reflect on oneself three times a day", leading her to busy days full of helping others.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Li Sushang]] - her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: snow_bros.
body:
[b][i]Snow Bros.[/i][/b] is a 1990 [[fantasy]] and platform action [[arcade]] [[video game]] originally developed by [[Toaplan]]. 

It was first published in Japan, then in North America by Romstar and later in Europe. 

Starring the eponymous snowmen twins Nick and Tom, players are tasked with travelling through 50 stages, throwing and building snowballs, jumping on and off platforms to navigate level obstacles while dodging and defeating monsters in order to rescue the princesses Puripuri and Puchipuchi from captivity. 

Although first launched in arcades, the game was later ported across multiple platforms, each one being created by different third-party developers and featuring several changes or additions compared with the original version. Conversions for various microcomputers were in development but none were officially released to the public.

Snow Bros. was met with mostly positive reception from critics and players alike, earning an award from Gamest magazine and gaining a cult following since its initial release. In 1994, a sequel titled [[Snow Bros. 2: With New Elves]] was released by Hanafram, serving as the last game by Toaplan prior to their closure. 

The rights to the title are owned by Tatsujin, a Japanese company formed by former Toaplan employee Yuge Masahiro. A revival version of the game for the [[Nintendo Switch]] was released on May 19th, 2022.

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Swords have a temper. Sometimes, you have to touch them to calm them down — put the hilt of the sword in your hand, and it'll tell you what's wrong!"

A sword hunter from the Xianzhou Zhuming and "the Flaming Heart" General Huaiyan's darling granddaughter. Frank and straightforward.
She practiced swordsmanship and forging from Huaiyan since young, and thus is the second-youngest prodigy swordmaster of the Flamewheel Octet.

Fueled by an intense loathing for the cursed swords that emerged from the Zhuming, she vowed to "hunt down and wipe out all cursed swords."
[/expand]

title: yume_koujou:_doki_doki_panic
body:
A Japan-exclusive platforming video game developed by [[Nintendo]] in cooperation with [[Fuji Television]] for the [[Famicom Disk System]] to promote its event called Yume Kōjō '87.

It was later released outside of Japan in an altered format under the name [[Super Mario Bros. 2]], since the original Japanese Super Mario Bros. sequel, Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels, was deemed too similar to the original and too difficult for overseas players. Eventually, the altered Super Mario version of Doki Doki Panic was released in Japan as well, under the title Super Mario USA.

A [[mecha]] ([i]Titan[/i]) that appeared in the game [[Battle of Titans]]. It is a heavy-class Titan with a shoulder-mounted laser weapon known as the [i]Dragon[/i].

Different from other [[walker (robot)|]] styled mecha in the game, Atlas is the only mecha that has a pair of mechanical arms connecting the weapons to its torso.

It frequently appears with a pair of [[autocannon]] known as the [i]Cyclone[/i].

title: dedf1sh
body:
NPC in [i][[Splatoon 2]][/i] and [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i].

A [[sanitized_(splatoon)|sanitized]] [[Octoling]] DJ that creates most of the music heard in [i][[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]][/i]. Her perfectionism in creating sounds led her to accidentally stumbling into a testing facility, where she was sanitized and remained for the entirety of the mode.

Like other sanitized members of her kind, she has [[green skin]] and [[purple_hair|purple]] [[tentacle hair]]. She wears a loose-fitting [[black shirt]] with [[bare shoulders]] as well as a [[baseball cap]], and appears to be wearing some sort of technological [[sunglasses]].

The supplementary magazine [i]Haikara Walker[/i] reveals her real name (in Japanese) to be [b]Mizuta Ahato[/b].
She later reappears under the name of [b]Acht[/b] in [i][[Splatoon 3: Side Order]][/i], where they are refered to as [b]Mizuta[/b] in Japanese. The name comes from Giant Pacific octopus (水蛸，mizutako). Notably, since their appearance in Side Order, Acht is referred to with they/them pronouns in English.

[b]Megalodon[/b] (Otodus megalodon) was a species of huge Mackerel [[shark]] estimated to be around 15 meters, making it one of notorious predators during the Early Miocene to Pliocene era.

It was believed to became extinct around 2.6 million years ago due to climate change.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Megalodon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megalodon]

title: train_driver
body:
A person who operates a [[train]]. The driver is in charge of the mechanical operation of the train, train speed, and all of the train handling (also known as brake handling).

A train driver may also be known as an engine driver, engineman, engineer, locomotive driver, locomotive handler, locomotive operator, train operator, or motorman.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Train driver":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Train_driver

title: useless_machine
body:
A machine whose only function is to turn itself off.

The best-known useless machines are those inspired by Marvin Minsky's design, in which the device's sole function is to switch itself off by operating its own "off" switch. Such machines were popularised commercially in the 1960s, sold as an amusing engineering hack, or as a joke.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Useless machine":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Useless_machine

title: ed_edd_n_eddy
body:
An animated television series created by Danny Antonucci for [[Cartoon Network]].

The series revolves around three friends named Ed, Edd (called "Double D" to avoid confusion with Ed), and Eddy. They live in a suburban cul-de-sac in the fictional town of Peach Creek along with fellow neighborhood children Kevin, Nazz, Sarah, Jimmy, Rolf, Jonny, and the Eds' female adversaries, the Kanker Sisters, Lee, Marie, and May. Under the unofficial leadership of Eddy, the trio frequently invents schemes to make money from their peers to purchase their favorite confection, jawbreakers. Their plans usually fail, leaving them in various, often humiliating and painful, predicaments.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ed, Edd n Eddy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed,_Edd_n_Eddy

title: amo_(bring_me_the_horizon)
body:
[[Amo (bring me the horizon)|]] is the sixth studio album of the British metalcore band [[Bring Me The Horizon]] after the release of the band's album "That's The Spirit".

Unlike most of the band's previous albums, "Amo" is described as a nu-metal, pop-metal album with electronic influence signifying the band's deparure from metalcore. The album also houses some of their highest-grossing singles "MANTRA" and nominated for the [i]Kerrang![/i] Awards for the Best Album as well as Grammy Awards for the Best Rock Album

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Amo (Bring Me The Horizon album)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amo_(Bring_Me_the_Horizon_album)

title: midsummer
body:
European tradition that celebrates summer, it occurs around summer solstice. The tradition is common in [[Sweden]] and other Nordic countries. 

A [[maypole]] is erected in many countries to celebrate midsummer. It as also common to dress in national costume and bear a [[head wreath]].

Not to be confused with the 2019 horror movie [[Midsommar]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Midsummer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midsummer

title: artillery
body: A weapon or war machine able to fire munitions beyond the effective range of personal weapons. This includes [[mortar (weapon)|]]s, [[cannon]]s and [[rocket launcher]]s. Other personal artillery pieces, such as mortars carried by troops, may fall into this category.

title: howitzer
body:
An [[artillery]] weapon that falls between a [[cannon]] and a [[mortar]]. With their long-range capabilities, howitzers can be used to great effect in a battery formation with other artillery pieces, such as long-barreled guns, mortars, and rocket artillery.

title: br_class_55
body:
The British Rail Class 55, also known as a Deltic, or English Electric Type 5, (Originally numbered as the D9000 series before the TOPS classification system.) is a class of [[diesel locomotive]] built in 1961 and 1962 by English Electric for British Railways. Twenty-two locomotives were built, designed for the high-speed express passenger services on the East Coast Main Line (ECML) between Edinburgh and London King's Cross. They gained the name "Deltic" from the prototype locomotive, DP1 Deltic (the running number DP1 was never carried), which in turn was named after its Napier Deltic power units.

h4. Examples

title: erect_clitoris
body:
A noticeable stiffening of the [[clitoris]], similar to a [[erection]]. Length may vary. The phenomenon is known as a clitoral erection and is a real sexual response in humans, caused by increase blood flow to the clitoris. The clitoris is the homolog to the penis which means it shares many functions with it, such as erections.

h4. See also

* [[Huge clitoris]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Clitoral erection":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clitoral_erection]

title: hair_stick
body:
A [[hair ornament]] used to hold hair up or simply to be decorative, or both. It is [[stick]] shaped, long and usually narrow. The hair is wrapped around the hair stick and then pinned in place.

Hair sticks are extremely old and can be traced back to ancient China, Egypt, Greece and India. They can be as simple as a literal stick or branch, or highly intricate with lots of detail. 

For hair sticks with Chinese elements or dangle objects, use hair stick and [[Chinese hairpin]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7231090: Two very simple hair sticks
* !post #7620312: Ordinary object used has hair sticks, in this case [[paintbrush]]es.
* !post #7956036: [[Branch]] used as a hair stick.
* !post #7326975: Ornate Chinese hair stick.

h4.See also

* [[Hairpin]]
* [[Kanzashi]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hair stick":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_stick]

title: alt_text
body: A post that has additional commentary in the "alt" text of the image. The alt text is an additional written description of the image, supported by some sites. It's usually seen by clicking an "ALT" button in the lower left corner of the image. It's intended to provide a written description of the image for blind users, but normally it's also used by artists as extra commentary (in a similar vein to the [code]title[/code] attribute of the [code][/code] element). It's called "alt text" because in HTML, the text is stored in the [code]alt[/code] attribute of the [code][/code] element, like this: [code] [/code] Alt text is currently supported by Twitter, Tumblr, and Bluesky. The alt text should be placed in the artist's commentary if it isn't automatically retrieved from the source. Be sure to add the [[commentary request]] tag if the text needs to be translated. If the source has multiple images with alt text attached to them, do not feature every image's alt text in the commentary of one image, unless necessary (ex. image #2's alt text builds off of image #1's alt text). Only include the alt text of the given image. h4. Examples * https://twitter.com/satsukinosora/status/1777652767097606186 * https://grumpygryphon.tumblr.com/post/735684444950790144 h4. Formatting for Danbooru commentaries [code] [quote] h6. Image Description Text here [/quote] [/code] h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Alt attribute":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alt_attribute

title: yume_(kuro_no_kiseki)
body: Yume is the energetic and pure-hearted daughter of [[Paulette (Kuro no Kiseki)|Paulette]]. She helps around in the Monmarte bistro as its poster girl, and is loved by customers and [[Van Arkride]] alike. Yumé doesn't know who her father is nor has Paulette talked to her about such complex matters, but she enjoys her life with her Monmarte family.

title: mihama_chiyo
body:
[[Azumanga Daioh]] character.

The pint-size genius girl in the Azumanga class. Chiyo starts the series at 10, but she's already been bumped up to high school. She still has the innocence of a grade-schooler, and with her brains and can-do attitude, she makes friends easily; her only flaw is having a chip on her shoulder about her size. She's also richer than sin and owns a [[Tadakichi-san|dog]] so big she can ride it.

Chiyo is universally called [b]Chiyo-chan[/b] (with rare exceptions when [[Tanizaki Yukari|Yukari]] gets mad enough to use the insulting "Chiyo-suke"). She wears her hair in [[twintails|pigtails]] that have a unique shape and, if you ask [[Kasuga Ayumu|Osaka]], a life of their own. Her [[Mihama chiyo's father|father]] is a whole separate subject.

title: flak_jacket
body:
A type of [[body armor]] designed to protect from from explosive weaponry such as anti-aircraft artillery ("flak" is a German contraction for [i]Fliegerabwehrkanone[/i], "aircraft-defense gun") or grenade fragments. Its prominent usage was by the US military during the [[Vietnam War]], but cannot provide protection against higher velocity (rifle) bullets.

Compared to more modern soft [[bulletproof vest]]s or plate carriers with rigid-looking front, flak jackets look more loose-fitting as if it they have soft quilt, having buttoned or zipper front top, collared appearance, and many of them feature [[pocket]]s or [[pouch]]es.
h4. Examples

title: mamianqun
body:
Mamianqun, (lit. 'Horse face skirt') is a traditonal Chinese skirt, considered a part of [[hanfu]]. The skirt originated from the [[Song dynasty|Song]] and [[Liao dynasty|Liao]] dynasties. 

The skirt is [[pleated skirt|pleated]] and is composed of two overlapping panels, attached to a band, which is then wrapped around the waist, making it a [[wrap skirt]]. It is typically long and can be easily recognized by its larger front and back pleats and smaller pleats along it's sides. 

Mamianqun is most often worn in [[aoqun]], but can be worn in [[ruqun]]. In modern times its also been worn with contemporary clothing items, creating a contrast between new and old. 

H4. Examples
* !post #7698009: A traditonal long mamianqun in purple. 
* !post #7660984: Knee-length mamianqun.

H4. See also
* [[Chinese clothes]]
* [[Hanfu]]
* [[Pleated skirt]]
* [[Wrap skirt]]

title: chinese_hairpin
body:
Ji (筓) (also known as fazan (髮簪 or 发簪), zanzi (簪子) or zan (簪) for short) and chai (钗) are generic term for hairpin in China. 'Ji' (with the same character of 笄) is also the term used for hairpins of the Qin dynasty. The earliest form of Chinese hair stick was found in the Neolithic Hemudu culture relics; the hair stick was called ji (笄), and were made from bones, horns, stones, and jade.

h4. See also
* [[Hair stick]]
* [[Hanfu]]
* [[Kanzashi]] (簪; Japanese hair ornaments including hairpin)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Chinese hairpin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_hairpin

title: hydarnes
body:
Persian general who served under [[Xerxes]].

Son of an earlier Hydarnes who helped Darius the Great overthrow the usurper Gaumata/Bardiya, he led the elite Persian Immortals at the Battle of Thermopylae. They initially struggled against Leonidas's line defending the pass but after being informed of a secret path by a Greek traitor the Persian forces flanked the Spartans through that path, thus winning the battle for the Persians.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Hydarnes the Younger":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydarnes_the_Younger]

title: wraith_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]]' base roster. A former IMC scientist who lost her memories after becoming a test subject in her own experiments.

In her default appearance, Wraith wears a [[black bodysuit]] with a [[black scarf]], two [[brown belt]]s, [[thigh strap]]s, [[grey gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She has [[black hair]] worn in a [[single hair bun|single]] [[hair bun|bun]] with [[parted bangs]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[nose piercing]]. Her eyes have [[no pupils]] on her in-game model, though she has pupils in promotional videos and lore cinematics.

Her heirloom weapons are  [[hope's dusk (apex legends)|Hope's Dusk]] and [[Hope's Dawn (apex legends)|]]. Often pictured alongside the [[portal (object)|]]s she makes for her ultimate ability.

Voiced by "Shantel VanShanten":[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1416900/] in English and "Kojima Sachiko":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%B3%B6%E5%B9%B8%E5%AD%90] in Japanese

h4. Interdimensional Skirmisher

* Real Name: [spoiler]Renee Blasey[/spoiler]
* Age: [spoiler]27[/spoiler]
* Home World: [spoiler]Typhon[/spoiler]
* Tactical Ability: Into the Void
* Passive Ability: Voices from the Void
* Ultimate Ability: Dimensional Rift

body:
Latin: [i]Horornis diphone[/i]
Japanese: 鶯 [i]uguisu[/i]

A small, drab, secretive perching bird. It is soft brown with a pale belly and eyebrow.

The distinctive breeding call of the uguisu can be heard throughout much of Japan from the start of spring.

title: boombox
body:
A portable [[stereo]] system with a carrying handle that plays music from [[CD]]s, [[cassette tape]]s, or the [[radio]] using builtin [[speaker]]s.

Designed for portability, boomboxes can be powered by batteries or by a wall outlet. The boombox was introduced to the American market during the mid 1970s. The desire for louder and heavier bass led to bigger and heavier boxes. Thus, by the 1980s, some boomboxes had reached the size of a suitcase.

h4. See also

* [[stereo]]

title: farm_merge_valley
body:
A casual farming social network game developed by CoolGames and published by Zynga (creator of Farmville). Originally releasing in November 2022 on Facebook, it has become available on multiple websites and services in the years since, most famously during Summer 2024 on Discord, via Discord Activities. The game received a surge of attention after getting added to Discord.

You merge animals, plants and resources together (at a minimum of 3 each, ideally 5) into higher tiers and exchange their products for coins, which you can use to buy more land.

title: paralympics
body: Posts related to the Paralympic Games, an international sport tournament held every four years. It is a counterpart for differently abled athletes (i.e. those with physical disabilities) to the [[Olympics]]. Typically has taken place in the same city as the Olympics since 1988 and a few weeks later.

title: alpaca_connect
body:
A play-by-web platform for TRPGs operated by a unique general-purpose system named "Lulmuhu", which allows players and game masters to host and participate in multiple game sessions, as well as managing their world-building. It also offers services such as "Alpaca Tailor", a commission service for medias (illustrations, voices, novels...) to use in TRPGs, and a point system to pay for PBW services.

Its company, Alpaca Connect Co., was founded in February 2019. 

h4. Copyrights under Alpaca Connect

* [[Bullshit Break]]

h4. See also

title: phimosis
body:
A condition where the penile [[foreskin]] cannot be fully retracted from the head of the [[penis]]. The term may also refer to [[clitoris|clitoral]] phimosis, whereby the [[clitoral hood]] cannot be retracted, limiting exposure of the glans clitoridis.

In pre-adolescence, the foreskin is adhered to the glans penis, gradually separating before adulthood, leading to a similar depiction for pre- and pubescent characters.

For tagging purposes, this is applicable when the prepuce is not depicted as fully retracted during an [[erection|erec]][[erect_clitoris|tion]].

title: letterman_jacket
body:
A sports [[jacket]] commonly worn by American high school/college students and athletes. Traditionally, the wearing of such a jacket indicates that the student has met a specified level of participation or performance on a varsity team.

Letterman jackets commonly have a large letter (hence "letter"man) on one side on the jackets chest, indicating typically the name of a school or team. The sleeves are often a different color from the jackets body. The jackets collar is often also horizontally striped.

h4. Examples

* !post #8016717: Letterman jacket with collar stripe, different arm and body colors and letter on the chest 
* !post #8042320: Letterman jacket without chest letter.
* !post #7639379

h4. See also

* [[sukajan]]
* [[track jacket]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Letterman (sports)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letterman_(sports)#Letter_jacket]

title: art_nouveau
body:
An art movement popular during the late 19th and early 20th century that combined fine art, graphic and industrial design. Although Art Nouveau was not a single style, Le Style Mucha (The style of (Alphonse) Mucha), as characterized by bold lines, flat, rich colors, flowing curves and ornate circular patterns is often considered the quintessential style of the movement.

The German version of Art Nouveau goes by "Jugend", german for "youth". In Sweden this is also the predominant term. Art Nouveau differs in style from country to country.

h4. See also

* [[Art Deco]]
* [[East Asian architecture]]
* [[Greco-Roman architecture]]
* [[Gothic architecture]]

title: japan_national_police
body:
Japan's national police force. Unlike the national police from various other countries, they do not have jurisdictions of their own. They are instead responsible for supervising every prefectural police department in the country.

h4. Identifications
There are several examples to make them qualify for the tag:
* Their [[police car]]s are painted white on the top and black on the bottom. Their emergency lights are red.
* Their [[bus]]es, [[truck]]s and [[police helicopter|helicopter]]s are painted blue.
* Their [[police uniform]]s are either a [[blue shirt]] and [[blue pants]] or [[white shirt]] and [[blue pants]].
* Some officers wear [[blue vest]]s, some others wear [[blue jacket]]s. Some officers may wear a [[blue necktie]] as well.
* Some officers wear a [[green armband]] on their left arm.
* Female police officers wear a round [[police hat]].

h4. Uniforms
* !post #8118201: [[Blue shirt]] with no vest
* !post #8131563: [[Blue shirt]] with a [[vest]]
* !post #6908855: [[White shirt]] with no vest
* !post #5289730: [[White shirt]] with a [[vest]]
* !post #5610903: [[Blue jacket]]
* !post #5260278: [[Riot police]]

h4. Vehicles
* !post #4787097: [[Police car]]
* !post #8127210: [[Police bus]]
* !post #3282589: [[Police helicopter]]

h4. See also

title: andou_ringo
body:
[[Puyopuyo]] character. She has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] styled into [[twin drills]], [[green eyes]], and a [[character hair ornament|puyo hair ornament]]. She debuted in [[Puyopuyo 7]].

* !asset #22968935: Puyopuyo 7

h4. Trivia
* Her motif and [[object namesake]] are all related to [[apple]]s; her [[catchphrase]]s are often mathematic references. 
* Her frequent [[w]] finger pose is a reference to "Fleming's right-hand rule":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fleming%27s_right-hand_rule].
* She's voiced by [[Imai Asami]] in Japanese and [[Cassandra Lee Morris]] in English.

title: itsumi_erika
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander of a [[Tiger II]], and second-in-command of the "Kuromorimine":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. She becomes the overall commander in Das Finale.

Voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Kuromorimine Girls Academy

h6. Original Anime

Vice-commanding officer of the Kuromorimine Girls Academy team. She is severely critical in regards to the former Vice-commander Miho.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1291877)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

New Commander of the Kuromorimine Girls Academy team. After Maho left for Germany, she was appointed as the new Commander.

title: pope_in_white_puffer_jacket_(meme)
body:
Pope in White Puffer Jacket, also known as Balenciaga Pope and [[Pope Francis]] Drip, is an [[AI-generated]] image of Pope Francis wearing a long white puffer coat, which was created with [[Midjourney]]. The photo inspired many jokes and memes about the Pope, drip and hip-hop culture. It also looked realistic enough to many that a notable portion believed it was a genuine photo, leading to debate over the consequences and possibilities of artificial intelligence.
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/pope-in-white-puffer-jacket-pope-francis-drip

title: swedish_flag
body:
The banner of the [[sweden|Kingdom of Sweden]].

The design of the flag is a heraldic-right-shifted (towards the flagpole) golden-yellow cross on a light middle-blue background. The exact dimensions of the flag are 4-2-4:5-2-9 for a total proportion of 10:16, which is number that approaches the golden ratio. Key things to take note of is that the blue fields towards the flagpole are [i]not[/i] square and the thickness of the cross is half of the blue fields' height.

Legends say that Eric IX ("Eric the Holy") saw the golden cross in the sky when he landed in Finland during the first Swedish crusade in 1157. He took it as a sign from god and made it his flag. However, the legend doesn't match up to the historic usage of the flag nor is there evidence of such a crusade. More likely, the Swedish flag was created in resistance to Denmark -Sweden's arch-nemesis since ancient times- and took inspiration from their flag, [[danish_flag|Dannebrogen]]. The blue and yellow were already commonly used as Swedish colours, for example in [[tre kronor]] which is the national [[coat of arms]].

There is a military variant of the flag which is significantly longer and has the end cut into three tongues. The proportions on this flag is 1:2. The tongues are cut from each field with the outer edges of the blue fields remaining straight and uncut. The length of the tongues is such that the uncut part of the flag has equally much blue on each side of the cross. The proportions are thus best described as 4-2-4:5-2-5-[b]8[/b] where the last number is the tongues. This flag can have white 5-pointed stars in the upper right field to denote admiralty rank and are only used on navy vessels. Other versions exists with a white square on the centre of the cross. If the square extends outside the cross and has the coat of arms of Sweden, then it is the flag of the King and Queen. Other members of the royal family uses a variant with a smaller square that doesn't extend outside the cross and instead carry a different insignia on it.

In civilian usage the flag was almost exclusively used at sea. The biggest breakthrough towards flying the flag more was made on the 6th of June in 1916 when "Day of the Swedish Flag" was celebrated for the first time, a day which unofficially became Sweden's national holiday until it was officially recognized in 1983.

There are no strict laws governing the flying of the flag, except for the royal and military variants. Everyone is allowed to fly the flag whenever they want and for whatever reason that they find worth flying it for. However, there are several traditions and "unwritten rules" which are good customs to follow, the most important of which is to not fly the flag at night and to not fly the flag for no reason. The most common occasion that Swedes fly the flag for are birthdays and midsummer's eve. Swedish calendars also come with special "flag days" marked, which are good days to fly the flag on such as royal birthdays and historical anniversaries.

* !asset #20125162

h4. See also

* [[Danish flag]]
* [[Finnish flag]]
* [[Icelandic flag]]
* [[Norwegian flag]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Sweden

title: russian_flag
body:
The Russian flag has three horizontal stripes of white, blue, and red respectively. 

In many cases, the term "Russian flag" is also synonymous with the flag of the Soviet Union, which is a red flag with a hammer and sickle logo on it. To prevent confusion, this flag is termed the [[Soviet flag]].
